The rich man in his castle, the poor man at his gate; God made them high and lowly, and ordered their estate.

Verse 3 of the popular hymn "All Things Bright and Beautiful"

by C.F Alexander, composed 1848.

Believing with you that religion is a matter which lies solely between Man & his God, that he owes account to none other for his faith or his worship, that the legitimate powers of government reach actions only, & not opinions, I contemplate with sovereign reverence that act of the whole American people which declared that their legislature should make no law respecting an establishment of religion"\n\n-Thomas Jefferson, 3rd President of the United States
A democracy is a government in the hands of men of low birth, no property, and vulgar employment\n\n-Aristotle
No dissenter rides in his coach for three generations -  he infallibly falls into the Establishment\n\n-Ralph Waldo Emerson
Bureaucracy is a giant mechanism operated by pygmies.\n\nHonor de Balzac
NEPOTISM, n. Appointing your grandmother to office for the good of the party.\n\n-Ambrose Bierce

Today we frankly recognize that democracy can be no more than aspiration, and have rule not so much by the people as  by the cleverest people; not an aristocracy of birth, not a  plutocracy of wealth, but a true meritocracy of talent\n\nMichael Young
Democracy means government by the uneducated, while aristocracy means government by the badly educated\n\n-G.K Chesterton
